page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
{ LITTLEHAMPTON DURING THE { SECOND WORLD WAR} During the second world war there were several air raids in Littlehampton. 101 bombs were dropped altogether: 90 H.E. bombs,5 oil bombs,1 parachute mine and 5 clusters of incendiaries. Two schools were hit: Elmgrove School and Connaugth road school were hit by 2 H.E. bombs on the 10 Feb. 1945 29 houses distroyed or damaged beyond repair 91 Houses severely dammaged 922 Houses with minor dammage More than 1,030 alerts No flying bombs 16 people killed, 15 seriously injured 71 minor casualties.
({H.E.}stands for HIGH EXPLOSIVE.)
